title: why is leblancs chain so long?
body: if shes going to have so much burst why not make it more difficult to land combo? walking out of the chain is pretty much impossible.

Reworked LeBlanc was a huge balance problem. She was literally permabanned everywhere soon after the assassin update occurred. She only stopped being a must ban when Riot gutted her W.

The only good thing about her rework was the RR. The forced delay on her bust was done in the worst way possible. She still has a bit of delay in that all her damage is on the back half of abilities instead of the front half (Q mark and E proc). She's a bit slower than before and a bit faster than the rework.

I don't think the rework was better considering counterplay. Yes she took more time to burst people, so much time that if you didn't win the game by minute 25 you'd auto loose, cause adc would burst you faster than you took to kill them. And to make her work as a champion she was given insane damage in early game, creating the most ridicolous feast or famine champion to ever exist. (Yes the reworked version was quite weak, for the last 1,5 years thus not standing out in any way, but hell no I don't want the lb rework back in the state she was in right after the rework) Getting destroyed by a reworked leblanc in lane is a lot more frustrating than the old /revertet lb

Though I do admit that lb needs some dmg nerfs in one of the next patches.
